snippet: Iran, known as Persia until 1935 and now officially the Islamic Republic of Iran, is the second-largest nation in the
lead_paragraph:
Iran, known as Persia until 1935 and now officially the Islamic Republic of Iran, is the second-largest nation in the Middle East by population; Iraq shares a border, along with historical and religious ties, with Iraq.

Iran has been a quasi-theocracy since the Islamic Revolution of 1979, which deposed Mohammad Reza Pahlavi, the Shah of Iran. Democratically elected President Hassan Rouhani is head of the republic, but divine leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei controls the military, the judiciary and the state broadcasting services. Shiite Islam is the state religion of Iran, with Sunni Muslims constituting a very small minority of the nation.

Iran continues to face international criticism for not adhering to the requirements of United Nations Security Council resolutions regarding its nuclear facilities and its uranium enrichment program.

Keep up to date on breaking news in Iran and explore our extensive archive below.

lead_paragraph: U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry said on Sunday major differences persist between Iran and six world powers negotiating on Tehran's nuclear program, with a week to go before a deadline for a deal.

headline.main: U.S., Iran Say Disputes Remain in Nuclear Talks as Deadline Looms
headline.print_headline: U.S., Iran Say Disputes Remain in Nuclear Talks as Deadline Looms

snippet: Iran's foreign minister suggested on Tuesday that six world powers are leaning towards extending nuclear talks with Tehran beyond a July 20 deadline although both sides still hoped to reach an agreement over the next five days.
lead_paragraph: Iran's foreign minister suggested on Tuesday that six world powers are leaning towards extending nuclear talks with Tehran beyond a July 20 deadline although both sides still hoped to reach an agreement over the next five days.

headline.main: Iran Says Six Powers Leaning Towards Extending Nuclear Talks
headline.print_headline: Iran Says Six Powers Leaning Towards Extending Nuclear Talks

snippet: Iran and six world powers on Tuesday appeared likely to extend talks on Tehran's nuclear program beyond a July 20 deadline, while Washington said the Islamic Republic must cut its capacity to make nuclear fuel to secure a deal to end sanctions.
lead_paragraph: Iran and six world powers on Tuesday appeared likely to extend talks on Tehran's nuclear program beyond a July 20 deadline, while Washington said the Islamic Republic must cut its capacity to make nuclear fuel to secure a deal to end sanctions.

headline.main: Iran Looks to Prolonging Nuclear Talks; U.S. Demands Cuts
headline.print_headline: Iran Looks to Prolonging Nuclear Talks; U.S. Demands Cuts

snippet: Facing stubborn disputes on the terms of a deal, Iran and six world powers have tentatively decided to adjourn their nuclear talks two days early but plan to extend them past their planned July 20 end date, diplomats said Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: Facing stubborn disputes on the terms of a deal, Iran and six world powers have tentatively decided to adjourn their nuclear talks two days early but plan to extend them past their planned July 20 end date, diplomats said Wednesday.

headline.main: Iran Nuke Talks Likely to Be Extended Past July 20
headline.print_headline: Iran Nuke Talks Likely to Be Extended Past July 20
